meanings.definition: A person who is farsighted and has difficulty seeing objects up close.
meanings.sent1: Many hyperopes need glasses to see things clearly up close.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist prescribed lenses for the hyperopes to improve their close-up vision.
meanings.sent3: The hyperopes at the library struggled to read the tiny print on the books.
meanings.sent4: In a world of tiny details, hyperopes are like explorers seeking clarity in the blur.
meanings.sent5: Hyperopes often squint when trying to focus on nearby objects.

meanings.sent1: The classroom was full of hyperopes, each with their own unique vision needs.
meanings.sent2: The optician specialized in crafting lenses for hyperopes in the community.
meanings.sent3: The hyperopes gathered for a group photo, all smiling behind their glasses.
meanings.sent4: Among the hyperopes, there was a sense of camaraderie in facing similar visual challenges.
meanings.sent5: The team of hyperopes worked together to design a vision-friendly workspace.
